title: ## Information Extraction from Unstructured, Noisy, or Insufficient Text Sources: A Reading List (2022 and Earlier

This list provides a diverse selection of articles covering various aspects of information extraction from challenging text sources. It includes works focusing on specific techniques, applications, and challenges
Deep Learning for Information Extraction" by Sebastian Riedel
Overview of deep learning techniques for information extraction, including neural networks for relation extraction and event extraction
End-to-End Relation Extraction using LSTMs on Sequences and Tree Structures" by Zhouhan Lin et al
Applying LSTMs for relation extraction, considering both sequential and tree-structured information in text
Joint Extraction of Entities and Relations Based on a Novel End-to-End Neural Network
A novel neural network architecture for jointly extracting entities and relations, improving efficiency and accuracy
Distant Supervision for Relation Extraction: A Survey" by Xiang Ren et al
A comprehensive survey of distant supervision techniques for relation extraction, exploring challenges and future directions
A Survey of Information Extraction Techniques for Noisy Text" by Amit Sheth et al
Discusses various techniques for information extraction from noisy text, including rule-based, statistical, and deep learning approaches
Information Extraction from Noisy Text: A Survey" by Amit Sheth et al
Similar to the previous entry, this survey explores techniques for information extraction from noisy text, emphasizing challenges and future directions
Information Extraction from Noisy Text: A Survey" by Amit Sheth et al
This survey provides a comprehensive overview of information extraction techniques for noisy text, including rule-based, statistical, and deep learning approaches
